title: Proverbs from 'Omishe Di Dole Eyovi'
description: Learn traditional Oshikwanyama proverbs and wisdom

questions.prompt: What does the proverb 'Omunwe umwe ihau tondoka outa' mean?
options: A single arrow cannot hit all targets
One finger cannot press a bow
The smallest finger is often the strongest
A bow without an arrow is useless
questions.correct: One finger cannot press a bow
questions.explanation: This proverb emphasizes the importance of cooperation. Just as you need multiple fingers to use a bow properly, many tasks require collaborative effort.

questions.prompt: Match these proverbs with their meanings

pairs.meaning: A mamba eats a python (even the mighty can fall)
A village is not built in a day (patience is needed)
A person is a river ford (humans should help each other)

questions.prompt: The proverb 'Omishe di dole eyovi' teaches us to:
options: Give up when things get difficult
Believe that all things are possible
questions.correct: Believe that all things are possible
questions.explanation: This proverb encourages perseverance and optimism. It suggests that with effort and determination, one can achieve what might seem impossible.
